meanings.definition: Causing mental or emotional strain or tension.
meanings.sent1: The exam was very stressful for the students.
meanings.sent2: Her job can be quite stressful at times.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all those tasks was a bit stressful, but we managed.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise in the city was a stressful reminder of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The image of the storm approaching was a stressful sight for the sailors.

meanings.sent1: The tightrope walker faced a stressful challenge.
meanings.sent2: The negotiation process can be very stressful for both parties.
meanings.sent3: The race to finish first was a stressful but exciting competition.
meanings.sent4: The clock ticking down added a stressful element to the game.
meanings.sent5: The suspenseful movie created a stressful atmosphere for the audience.
